required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: An Observational Study of RoActemra/Actemra (Tocilizumab) As Monotherapy in Rheumatoid Arthritis Patients in Routine Clinical Practice
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Factors Influencing Use of RoActemra® as Monotherapy in Rheumatoid Arthritis Patients in a Real Life Setting - ACT SOLO

brief_summary.textblock: This prospective, multi-center, observational study will evaluate factors influencing the use of tocilizumab (RoActemra/Actemra) as monotherapy in rheumatoid arthritis patients in real life setting. Data will be collected from participants for 12 months following initiation of tocilizumab treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Assigned Tocilizumab Monotherapy Versus Tocilizumab as Part of Combination Therapy at Study Inclusion
primary_outcome.description: The number of participants assigned to tocilizumab monotherapy versus tocilizumab combination therapy is reported. A multivariate analysis was performed to search for predictive factors for the initiation of tocilizumab in monotherapy.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Receiving Tocilizumab Monotherapy Who Discontinued Methotrexate (MTX)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (assessment of discontinuations within prior 2 years)
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of participants who discontinued MTX treatment prior to being assigned to tocilizumab monotherapy is presented by reason for discontinuation. Reason for discontinuation "Other Intolerance" = intolerance other than cytopenia or hepatic cytolysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Receiving Tocilizumab Monotherapy Who Discontinued Leflunomide
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (assessment of discontinuations within prior 2 years)
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of participants who discontinued leflunomide treatment prior to being assigned to tocilizumab monotherapy is presented by reason for discontinuation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Receiving Tocilizumab Monotherapy Who Discontinued Sulfasalazine
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (assessment of discontinuations within prior 2 years)
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of participants who discontinued sulfasalazine treatment prior to being assigned to tocilizumab monotherapy is presented by reason for discontinuation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Receiving Tocilizumab Monotherapy Who Discontinued Hydroxychloroquine
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (assessment of discontinuations within prior 2 years)
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of participants who discontinued hydroxychloroquine treatment prior to being assigned to tocilizumab monotherapy is presented by reason for discontinuation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Receiving Tocilizumab Monotherapy Who Discontinued Unspecified Conventional Synthetic Disease-modifying Antirheumatic Drugs (csDMARDs)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (assessment of discontinuations within prior 2 years)
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of participants who discontinued treatment with unspecified csDMARDs prior to being assigned to tocilizumab monotherapy is presented by reason for discontinuation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Number of Tocilizumab Infusions Over the Study Period
Percentage of Participants Who Received Tocilizumab Infusions Over the Study Period
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of participants who received infusions is presented by category of total infusions received over the study period.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With No Modification of Tocilizumab Treatment Over the Study Period
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of participants with no modifications (dose modification or discontinuation) is presented.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With at Least One csDMARD Intensification During the Study
secondary_outcome.description: csDMARD intensification was defined as an addition of a csDMARD without suppression of other csDMARD, dose increase of a csDMARD, switch (addition and suppression) of a csDMARD without intolerance, biological abnormality or symptom improvement to the suppressed csDMARD, or modification of the MTX administration route (from oral route to intramuscular/subcutaneous) with dose increase or maintenance.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants in Disease Activity Score Based on 28-joint Count and Erythrocyte Sedimentation Rate (DAS28-ESR) Low Disease Activity (LDA) at Month 12
secondary_outcome.description: DAS28-ESR was calculated from the number of swollen joints and tender joints using the 28-joint count, ESR (mm/hour) and patient's global assessment of disease activity; scores range from 0 to 10, where lower scores indicate less disease activity. A score of ≤3.2 was considered to be DAS28-ESR LDA. Participants with missing data were considered to have failed to achieve the outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With DAS28-ESR Remission at Month 12
secondary_outcome.description: DAS28-ESR was calculated from the number of swollen joints and tender joints using the 28-joint count, ESR (mm/hour) and patient's global assessment of disease activity; scores range from 0 to 10, where lower scores indicate less disease activity. A score of <2.6 was considered to be DAS28-ESR remission. Participants with missing data were considered to have failed to achieve the outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Clinical Disease Activity Index (CDAI) LDA at Month 12
secondary_outcome.description: CDAI was calculated from the number of swollen joints and tender joints using the 28-joint count and the patient's global assessment of disease activity and physician's global assessment of disease activity; CDAI scores range from 0 to 76, where lower scores indicate less disease activity. A score of ≤10 was considered to be CDAI LDA. Participants with missing data were considered to have failed to achieve the outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With CDAI Remission at Month 12
secondary_outcome.description: CDAI was calculated from the number of swollen joints and tender joints using the 28-joint count and the patient's global assessment of disease activity and physician's global assessment of disease activity; CDAI scores range from 0 to 76, where lower scores indicate less disease activity. A score of ≤2.8 was considered to be CDAI remission. Participants with missing data were considered to have failed to achieve the outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Simplified Disease Activity Index (SDAI) LDA at Month 12
secondary_outcome.description: SDAI was calculated from the number of swollen joints and tender joints using the 28-joint count, C-reactive protein (CRP) (milligrams per liter (mg/L)) per , and the patient's global assessment of disease activity and physician's global assessment of disease activity; SDAI scores range from 0 to 86, where lower scores indicate less disease activity. A score of ≤11 was considered to be SDAI LDA. Participants with missing data were considered to have failed to achieve the outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With SDAI Remission at Month 12
secondary_outcome.description: SDAI was calculated from the number of swollen joints and tender joints using the 28-joint count, CRP (mg/L), and the patient's global assessment of disease activity and physician's global assessment of disease activity; SDAI scores range from 0 to 86, where lower scores indicate less disease activity. A score of ≤3.3 was considered to be SDAI remission. Participants with missing data were considered to have failed to achieve the outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With American College or Rheumatology (ACR)20, ACR50, and ACR70 at Month 12
secondary_outcome.description: ACR20/50/70 response was calculated as improvement (from baseline) of at least 20/50/70% (respectively) of tender and of swollen joints, and improvement from baseline of least 20/50/70% (respectively) in at least 3 of the 5 following parameters: participant's pain assessment, patient's global assessment of disease activity, physician's global assessment of disease activity, health assessment questionnaire disability index (HAQ-DI) score, and ESR (mm/hour) or CRP (mg/L). Participants with missing data were considered to have failed to achieve the outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Good or Moderate European League Against Rheumatism (EULAR) Response at Month 12
secondary_outcome.description: EULAR response was categorized as good or moderate response and was calculated as the difference between DAS28-ESR scores at baseline and Month 12. DAS28-ESR was calculated from the number of swollen joints and tender joints using the 28-joint count, ESR (mm/hour) and patient's global assessment of disease activity; scores range from 0 to 10, where lower scores indicate less disease activity. If diminution from baseline >1.2 and score ≤3.2 at Month 12 = good response If diminution from baseline >1.2 and score >3.2 at Month 12 = moderate response If diminution from baseline >0.6 and ≤1.2, and score ≤5.1 at Month 12 = moderate response If diminution from baseline >0.6 and ≤1.2, and score >5.1 at Month 12 = non-response If diminution from baseline ≤1.2 at Month 12 = non-response Participants with missing data were considered as non-response

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Health Assessment Questionnaire Disability Index (HAQ-DI) Score
secondary_outcome.description: The HAQ-DI is a participant-reported assessment of ability to perform daily living activities. This composite index score ranges from 0 (normal) to 3 (total functional disability) and includes questions regarding 8 domains (dress/groom; arise; eat; walk; reach; grip; hygiene; and common activities over past week). A decrease in score corresponds to improvement in participant-assessed health state.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Rheumatoid Arthritis Impact of Disease (RAID) Score
secondary_outcome.description: The RAID questionnaire is a participant-reported outcome measure evaluating the impact of rheumatoid arthritis on participant quality of life. This composite index score ranges from 0 (best) to 10 (worst) and includes questions regarding 7 domains (pain, functional disability assessment, fatigue, sleep, physical well-being, emotional well-being, coping). A decrease in score corresponds to improvement in participant-assessed health state.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Acceptable Health State Assessed by the Patient Acceptable Symptom State (PASS) Questionnaire.
secondary_outcome.description: Participants were asked: "If you were to remain in the same condition for the next few months as you have been over the last 8 days, would this be 1) acceptable, 2) unacceptable?" The percentage of participants who responded "acceptable" at each time point is presented.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Adverse Events
secondary_outcome.description: An adverse event was defined as any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding if accompanied by clinical symptoms, results in a change in study treatment, results in a medical intervention or a change in concomitant therapy or clinically significant in the investigator's judgment), symptom, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medicinal product, whether or not considered related to the medicinal product.

arm_group.description: Tocilizumab administered as monotherapy or in combination with other standard of care therapy according to prescribing information and normal clinical practice.

intervention.description: Tocilizumab administered according to prescribing information and normal clinical practice.

study_pop.textblock: Moderate to severe rheumatoid arthritis participants treated with tocilizumab in routine clinical practice

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult participants, >/= 18 years of age
- Patients with rheumatoid arthritis for whom the rheumatologist decides to start tocilizumab in combination with DMARD or as monotherapy
Exclusion Criteria:
- Current participation in a clinical trial in rheumatoid arthritis

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Participants were not allocated to study arms but were separated according to therapy regimen post hoc for efficacy and safety analyses. Of the 608 participants enrolled 5 were not eligible for analysis (1 was found to be duplicate and 4 did not receive tocilizumab infusion).

group.title: All Tocilizumab
group.description: Tocilizumab (RoActemra/Actemra) administered as monotherapy or in combination with other standard of care therapy according to prescribing information and normal clinical practice.

participants_list.participants: Received tocilizumab infusion and met all inclusion/exclusion criteria

drop_withdraw_reason.title: Patient No Longer Wanted to Participate

baseline.population: Efficacy population, defined as all participants who received at least one infusion of tocilizumab and who met all inclusion and exclusion criteria.

group.title: Tocilizumab Monotherapy
group.description: Tocilizumab administered as monotherapy according to prescribing information and normal clinical practice.

group.title: Tocilizumab Combination Therapy
group.description: Tocilizumab administered in combination with other standard of care therapy according to prescribing information and normal clinical practice.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Age
Gender

outcome.title: Number of Participants Assigned Tocilizumab Monotherapy Versus Tocilizumab as Part of Combination Therapy at Study Inclusion
outcome.description: The number of participants assigned to tocilizumab monotherapy versus tocilizumab combination therapy is reported. A multivariate analysis was performed to search for predictive factors for the initiation of tocilizumab in monotherapy.
outcome.population: Efficacy population, defined as all participants who received at least one infusion of tocilizumab and who met all inclusion and exclusion criteria.

group.title: All Tocilizumab
group.description: Tocilizumab administered as monotherapy or in combination with other standard of care therapy according to prescribing information and normal clinical practice.

measure.title: Number of Participants Assigned Tocilizumab Monotherapy Versus Tocilizumab as Part of Combination Therapy at Study Inclusion
measure.description: The number of participants assigned to tocilizumab monotherapy versus tocilizumab combination therapy is reported. A multivariate analysis was performed to search for predictive factors for the initiation of tocilizumab in monotherapy.
measure.population: Efficacy population, defined as all participants who received at least one infusion of tocilizumab and who met all inclusion and exclusion criteria.

analysis.groups_desc: Influence of baseline factor "Patient's Age (>=65)" upon physician's decision to initiate tocilizumab monotherapy (multivariate analysis).
analysis.method_desc: Wald Chi-square Test for Type 3 generalized estimating equation (GEE) Analysis.

analysis.groups_desc: Influence of baseline factor "No methotrexate (MTX) sequences within the two last years" upon physician's decision to initiate tocilizumab monotherapy (multivariate analysis).
analysis.method_desc: Wald Chi-square Test for Type 3 GEE Analysis.

analysis.groups_desc: Influence of baseline factor "Past history of severe infectious disease" upon physician's decision to initiate tocilizumab monotherapy (multivariate analysis).
analysis.method_desc: Wald Chi-square Test for Type 3 GEE Analysis.

analysis.groups_desc: Influence of baseline factor "Higher Disease Activity Score Based on 28-joint Count and Erythrocyte Sedimentation Rate (DAS28-ESR) (unit=1)" on physician decision to initiate tocilizumab monotherapy; DAS28-ESR was calculated from the number of swollen joints and tender joints using 28-joint count, ESR (millimeters per hour [mm/hour]) and patient’s global assessment of disease activity; scores range from 0 to 10; higher scores correspond to greater disease activity (multivariate analysis).
analysis.method_desc: Wald Chi-square Test for Type 3 GEE Analysis.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Receiving Tocilizumab Monotherapy Who Discontinued Methotrexate (MTX)
outcome.description: The percentage of participants who discontinued MTX treatment prior to being assigned to tocilizumab monotherapy is presented by reason for discontinuation. Reason for discontinuation "Other Intolerance" = intolerance other than cytopenia or hepatic cytolysis.
outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (assessment of discontinuations within prior 2 years)
outcome.population: Participants in the Tocilizumab Monotherapy group (Efficacy population) who discontinued MTX and with available data.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With at Least One csDMARD Intensification During the Study
outcome.description: csDMARD intensification was defined as an addition of a csDMARD without suppression of other csDMARD, dose increase of a csDMARD, switch (addition and suppression) of a csDMARD without intolerance, biological abnormality or symptom improvement to the suppressed csDMARD, or modification of the MTX administration route (from oral route to intramuscular/subcutaneous) with dose increase or maintenance.
outcome.population: Participants in Efficacy population who received at least 1 infusion of tocilizumab, who met all inclusion/exclusion criteria, and with no permanent discontinuation of tocilizumab treatment over the study period. For efficacy criteria with response/non response values, participants with non-evaluable response were considered as non-responders.

A score of ≤3.2 was considered to be DAS28-ESR LDA. Participants with missing data were considered to have failed to achieve the outcome.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With SDAI Remission at Month 12
outcome.description: SDAI was calculated from the number of swollen joints and tender joints using the 28-joint count, CRP (mg/L), and the patient’s global assessment of disease activity and physician's global assessment of disease activity; SDAI scores range from 0 to 86, where lower scores indicate less disease activity. A score of ≤3.3 was considered to be SDAI remission. Participants with missing data were considered to have failed to achieve the outcome.
outcome.population: Efficacy population, defined as all participants who received at least one infusion of tocilizumab and who met all inclusion and exclusion criteria.

group.title: Tocilizumab Monotherapy
group.description: Tocilizumab administered as monotherapy according to prescribing information and normal clinical practice.

group.title: Tocilizumab Combination Therapy
group.description: Tocilizumab administered in combination with other standard of care therapy according to prescribing information and normal clinical practice.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With SDAI Remission at Month 12
measure.description: SDAI was calculated from the number of swollen joints and tender joints using the 28-joint count, CRP (mg/L), and the patient’s global assessment of disease activity and physician's global assessment of disease activity; SDAI scores range from 0 to 86, where lower scores indicate less disease activity. A score of ≤3.3 was considered to be SDAI remission. Participants with missing data were considered to have failed to achieve the outcome.
measure.population: Efficacy population, defined as all participants who received at least one infusion of tocilizumab and who met all inclusion and exclusion criteria.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With American College or Rheumatology (ACR)20, ACR50, and ACR70 at Month 12
outcome.description: ACR20/50/70 response was calculated as improvement (from baseline) of at least 20/50/70% (respectively) of tender and of swollen joints, and improvement from baseline of least 20/50/70% (respectively) in at least 3 of the 5 following parameters: participant's pain assessment, patient's global assessment of disease activity, physician’s global assessment of disease activity, health assessment questionnaire disability index (HAQ-DI) score, and ESR (mm/hour) or CRP (mg/L). Participants with missing data were considered to have failed to achieve the outcome.
outcome.population: Efficacy population, defined as all participants who received at least one infusion of tocilizumab and who met all inclusion and exclusion criteria.

group.title: Tocilizumab Monotherapy
group.description: Tocilizumab administered as monotherapy according to prescribing information and normal clinical practice.

group.title: Tocilizumab Combination Therapy
group.description: Tocilizumab administered in combination with other standard of care therapy according to prescribing information and normal clinical practice.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With American College or Rheumatology (ACR)20, ACR50, and ACR70 at Month 12
measure.description: ACR20/50/70 response was calculated as improvement (from baseline) of at least 20/50/70% (respectively) of tender and of swollen joints, and improvement from baseline of least 20/50/70% (respectively) in at least 3 of the 5 following parameters: participant's pain assessment, patient's global assessment of disease activity, physician’s global assessment of disease activity, health assessment questionnaire disability index (HAQ-DI) score, and ESR (mm/hour) or CRP (mg/L). Participants with missing data were considered to have failed to achieve the outcome.
measure.population: Efficacy population, defined as all participants who received at least one infusion of tocilizumab and who met all inclusion and exclusion criteria.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Good or Moderate European League Against Rheumatism (EULAR) Response at Month 12
outcome.description: EULAR response was categorized as good or moderate response and was calculated as the difference between DAS28-ESR scores at baseline and Month 12. DAS28-ESR was calculated from the number of swollen joints and tender joints using the 28-joint count, ESR (mm/hour) and patient's global assessment of disease activity; scores range from 0 to 10, where lower scores indicate less disease activity. If diminution from baseline >1.2 and score ≤3.2 at Month 12 = good response If diminution from baseline >1.2 and score >3.2 at Month 12 = moderate response If diminution from baseline >0.6 and ≤1.2, and score ≤5.1 at Month 12 = moderate response If diminution from baseline >0.6 and ≤1.2, and score >5.1 at Month 12 = non-response If diminution from baseline ≤1.2 at Month 12 = non-response Participants with missing data were considered as non-response
outcome.population: Efficacy population, defined as all participants who received at least one infusion of tocilizumab and who met all inclusion and exclusion criteria.

group.title: Tocilizumab Monotherapy
group.description: Tocilizumab administered as monotherapy according to prescribing information and normal clinical practice.

group.title: Tocilizumab Combination Therapy
group.description: Tocilizumab administered in combination with other standard of care therapy according to prescribing information and normal clinical practice.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Good or Moderate European League Against Rheumatism (EULAR) Response at Month 12
measure.description: EULAR response was categorized as good or moderate response and was calculated as the difference between DAS28-ESR scores at baseline and Month 12. DAS28-ESR was calculated from the number of swollen joints and tender joints using the 28-joint count, ESR (mm/hour) and patient's global assessment of disease activity; scores range from 0 to 10, where lower scores indicate less disease activity. If diminution from baseline >1.2 and score ≤3.2 at Month 12 = good response If diminution from baseline >1.2 and score >3.2 at Month 12 = moderate response If diminution from baseline >0.6 and ≤1.2, and score ≤5.1 at Month 12 = moderate response If diminution from baseline >0.6 and ≤1.2, and score >5.1 at Month 12 = non-response If diminution from baseline ≤1.2 at Month 12 = non-response Participants with missing data were considered as non-response
measure.population: Efficacy population, defined as all participants who received at least one infusion of tocilizumab and who met all inclusion and exclusion criteria.

outcome.title: Mean Change From Baseline in Health Assessment Questionnaire Disability Index (HAQ-DI) Score
outcome.description: The HAQ-DI is a participant-reported assessment of ability to perform daily living activities. This composite index score ranges from 0 (normal) to 3 (total functional disability) and includes questions regarding 8 domains (dress/groom; arise; eat; walk; reach; grip; hygiene; and common activities over past week). A decrease in score corresponds to improvement in participant-assessed health state.
outcome.population: Participants in the Efficacy population who received at least one infusion of tocilizumab, who met all inclusion and exclusion criteria, and with available data at the respective time point.

group.title: Tocilizumab Monotherapy
group.description: Tocilizumab administered as monotherapy according to prescribing information and normal clinical practice.

group.title: Tocilizumab Combination Therapy
group.description: Tocilizumab administered in combination with other standard of care therapy according to prescribing information and normal clinical practice.

measure.title: Mean Change From Baseline in Health Assessment Questionnaire Disability Index (HAQ-DI) Score
measure.description: The HAQ-DI is a participant-reported assessment of ability to perform daily living activities. This composite index score ranges from 0 (normal) to 3 (total functional disability) and includes questions regarding 8 domains (dress/groom; arise; eat; walk; reach; grip; hygiene; and common activities over past week). A decrease in score corresponds to improvement in participant-assessed health state.
measure.population: Participants in the Efficacy population who received at least one infusion of tocilizumab, who met all inclusion and exclusion criteria, and with available data at the respective time point.

outcome.title: Mean Change From Baseline in Rheumatoid Arthritis Impact of Disease (RAID) Score
outcome.description: The RAID questionnaire is a participant-reported outcome measure evaluating the impact of rheumatoid arthritis on participant quality of life. This composite index score ranges from 0 (best) to 10 (worst) and includes questions regarding 7 domains (pain, functional disability assessment, fatigue, sleep, physical well-being, emotional well-being, coping). A decrease in score corresponds to improvement in participant-assessed health state.
outcome.population: Participants in the Efficacy population who received at least one infusion of tocilizumab, who met all inclusion and exclusion criteria, and with available data at the respective time point.

group.description: Tocilizumab administered as monotherapy according to prescribing information and normal clinical practice.

group.title: Tocilizumab Combination Therapy
group.description: Tocilizumab administered in combination with other standard of care therapy according to prescribing information and normal clinical practice.

measure.title: Mean Change From Baseline in Rheumatoid Arthritis Impact of Disease (RAID) Score
measure.description: The RAID questionnaire is a participant-reported outcome measure evaluating the impact of rheumatoid arthritis on participant quality of life. This composite index score ranges from 0 (best) to 10 (worst) and includes questions regarding 7 domains (pain, functional disability assessment, fatigue, sleep, physical well-being, emotional well-being, coping). A decrease in score corresponds to improvement in participant-assessed health state.
measure.population: Participants in the Efficacy population who received at least one infusion of tocilizumab, who met all inclusion and exclusion criteria, and with available data at the respective time point.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Acceptable Health State Assessed by the Patient Acceptable Symptom State (PASS) Questionnaire.
outcome.description: Participants were asked: "If you were to remain in the same condition for the next few months as you have been over the last 8 days, would this be 1) acceptable, 2) unacceptable?" The percentage of participants who responded "acceptable" at each time point is presented.
outcome.population: Participants in the Efficacy population who received at least one infusion of tocilizumab, who met all inclusion and exclusion criteria, and with available data at the respective time point.

group.description: Tocilizumab administered as monotherapy according to prescribing information and normal clinical practice.

group.description: Tocilizumab administered in combination with other standard of care therapy according to prescribing information and normal clinical practice.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Adverse Events
outcome.description: An adverse event was defined as any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding if accompanied by clinical symptoms, results in a change in study treatment, results in a medical intervention or a change in concomitant therapy or clinically significant in the investigator’s judgment), symptom, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medicinal product, whether or not considered related to the medicinal product.
outcome.population: Safety population, defined as participants who received at least one infusion of tocilizumab.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)
Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The Study being conducted under this Agreement is part of the Overall Study. Investigator is free to publish in reputable journals or to present at professional conferences the results of the Study, but only after the first publication or presentation that involves the Overall Study. The Sponsor may request that Confidential Information be deleted and/or the publication be postponed in order to protect the Sponsor’s intellectual property rights.
